The discovery of immortality could revolutionize our understanding of the human experience and lead to a reevaluation of our societal values and beliefs. It could also lead to a population explosion as people have more time to reproduce and live longer.

The existence of immortals could create a class system, where those who have immortality are seen as superior to those who do not. This could lead to discrimination anding, as immortals may have more resources anding than those who do not.
Immortality could lead to a lack of personal growth and development, as people have no need to fear death and may not feel the same sense of urgency to achieve their goals.
Immortality could lead to a loss of individuality, as people may become more like each other over time and lose their unique personalities and identities.
Immortality could lead to a lack of empathy and compassion, as people may not feel the same sense of urgency to help others and may become more selfish and focused on their own needs and desires.
